meanings.definition: Cause (something) to be out of harmony or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The loud music disharmonized the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent2: The conflicting opinions disharmonized the group discussion.
meanings.sent3: The out-of-tune piano disharmonized the otherwise lovely melody.
meanings.sent4: The sudden change in key disharmonized the entire song.
meanings.sent5: The off-key singing disharmonized the choir performance.

meanings.sent1: The disharmonized colors of the painting clashed with each other.
meanings.sent2: The disharmonized voices in the choir sounded unpleasant.
meanings.sent3: The disharmonized patterns on the shirt made it look quirky.
meanings.sent4: The disharmonized flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent5: The disharmonized elements of the design made it stand out.
